title.native: アリスとテレスのまぼろし工場
title.romaji: Alice to Therese no Maboroshi Koujou

description:
Masamune, a third-year middle school student, lives in a town where all the exits have been sealed off due to a sudden explosion at a steel mill, causing time to stand still. Residents are forbidden from making any changes and spend their suffocating days in the hopes of returning to normalcy someday.

One day, Masamune's mysterious classmate Mutsumi guides him to the fifth furnace of the steel mill, where they encounter a girl who cannot speak and resembles a wild wolf. The meeting between the two girls and Masamune disrupts the balance of the world, and the unstoppable "impulse of love" from boys and girls tired of their daily lives begins to destroy the world.
hashtag: #まぼろし工場 #アリスとテレスのまぼろし工場 #maboroshi

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Incest
tags.description: Features sexual or romantic relations between characters who are related by blood.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Parenthood
tags.description: Centers around the experience of raising a child.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

Affiliated with [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/).

Although at first becoming a salary man after graduation, he later decided to become animator and joined Nakamura Production, where he debuted on [Bugtte Honey](https://anilist.co/anime/10210/) in 1987. He later joined Studio Gainax and was involved in the production of [Evangelion](https://anilist.co/anime/30/Shin-Seiki-Evangelion/). In 1998 he debuted as character designer of [Kare Kano](https://anilist.co/anime/145/Kareshi-Kanojo-no-Jijou/).
Recipient of the Individual Award at The 16th Animation Kobe Awards in 2011.

Frequents on [P.A. Works](https://anilist.co/studio/132/)' projects, but is freelance.

Was inspired to become an animator after having seen [Ninku](https://anilist.co/anime/912/).

Frequents on [P.A. Works](https://anilist.co/studio/132/)' projects, but is freelance.

Was inspired to become an animator after having seen [Ninku](https://anilist.co/anime/912/).

__Graduated:__ Kunitachi College of Music (Department of Composition)

[Artist Profile (Miracle Bus)](http://miraclebus.com/composer/masaruyokoyama) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/masaruyokoyama)

**Yokoyama Masaru** is a Japanese composer, arranger, keyboardist and programmer affiliated with Miracle Bus.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Higashiji)
Recipient of the Individual Award at The 16th Animation Kobe Awards in 2011.
Recipient of the Individual Award at The 16th Animation Kobe Awards in 2011.

[Website](https://www.miyuki.jp/s/y10/?ima=5442) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/miyuki_staff) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/miyukiofficial)

She has released 37 studio albums, 40 singles, 2 live albums and multiple compilations. Her sales have been estimated at more than 21 million copies. In addition to her work as a solo artist, Nakajima has written over 90 compositions for numerous other singers, and has produced several chart-toppers. She has also had many cover versions of her songs performed by Asian singers, especially Taiwanese and Hong Kong ones. She is the only musician to have participated in the National Language Council of Japan. Her songs are often used in TV dramas, and she herself was an actor in some movies, like Sayonara COLOR. She is famous for her strict and powerful manner of singing and inspiring, lively and expressive lyrics. In November of 2009, Nakajima was awarded with Medal of Honor with purple ribbon by the Government of Japan.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/269534582)

Originating from [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/).
Director and General Manager of CGI Department at [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/). He's also a Board Member at [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Kimu777)

Makoto Kimura is an animation producer originally from Fuji TV Noitamina. He then moved to [Twin Engine](https://anilist.co/studio/6199/Twin-Engine) and later then to Studio [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/MAPPA) where he was the Director of Planning Department. In April 2024, he left MAPPA and formed BLUE RIGHTS Co. Ltd.

_Note: Not to be confused with the background artist [Makoto Kimura](https://anilist.co/staff/182523/)._
Former Head of the Production Department at [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/). Currently Producer at Chocolate Inc.

Began his career in animation at [Studio 4°C](https://anilist.co/studio/13/), where he worked on projects like [Genius Party Beyond](https://anilist.co/anime/6795/). In 2011, he was handpicked by then president [Masao Maruyama](https://anilist.co/staff/103170/) to join [Mappa](https://anilist.co/studio/569/) as a producer. He then went on to work as an animation producer on numerous titles such as [Kids on the Slope](https://anilist.co/anime/12531/), [Terror in Resonance](https://anilist.co/anime/20661/) and [Shingeki no Bahamut: Genesis](https://anilist.co/anime/20590/).

In April 2016, Maruyama handed Ootsuka the reigns of the studio and he took on the role of a producer and the CEO.

Began his career in animation at [Studio 4°C](https://anilist.co/studio/13/), where he worked on projects like [Genius Party Beyond](https://anilist.co/anime/6795/). In 2011, he was handpicked by then president [Masao Maruyama](https://anilist.co/staff/103170/) to join [Mappa](https://anilist.co/studio/569/) as a producer. He then went on to work as an animation producer on numerous titles such as [Kids on the Slope](https://anilist.co/anime/12531/), [Terror in Resonance](https://anilist.co/anime/20661/) and [Shingeki no Bahamut: Genesis](https://anilist.co/anime/20590/).

In April 2016, Maruyama handed Ootsuka the reigns of the studio and he took on the role of a producer and the CEO.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Higashiji)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/156204341) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/hiramatz/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/tadashi-hiramatz/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/@hiramatz1963)

Affiliated with [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/).

Although at first becoming a salary man after graduation, he later decided to become animator and joined Nakamura Production, where he debuted on [Bugtte Honey](https://anilist.co/anime/10210/) in 1987. He later joined Studio Gainax and was involved in the production of [Evangelion](https://anilist.co/anime/30/Shin-Seiki-Evangelion/). In 1998 he debuted as character designer of [Kare Kano](https://anilist.co/anime/145/Kareshi-Kanojo-no-Jijou/).

Originating from Studio Annapuru, where he worked under the supervision of [Osamu Dezaki](https://anilist.co/staff/100393/) and [Akio Sugino](https://anilist.co/staff/103064/). He went independent after leaving the studio in 1991. As a freelancer he worked on numerous works as a key animator and started quickly getting recognized as one of the strongest action animators in the industry.

In 2000, Andou made his debut as an episode director with [Medarot](https://anilist.co/anime/1138/)'s 49th episode, and started gradually shifting his focus from animating to directing and storyboarding episodes himself. He mainly worked on studio [Bones](https://anilist.co/studio/4/)' productions in the early '00s, and got to direct several episodes of [RahXephon](https://anilist.co/anime/165/), [Wolf's Rain](https://anilist.co/anime/202/) and [Fullmetal Alchemist](https://anilist.co/anime/121/). In 2007, he directed [Sword of the Stranger](https://anilist.co/anime/2418/), a film which was also produced by Bones. He has since directed multiple shows for both Bones and [P.A. Works](https://anilist.co/studio/132/).

Noted for his action storyboards. He is also close friends with [Masahiro Satou](https://anilist.co/staff/134126/) and often works with him.

_Note: Not to be confused with older animator [Masahiro Andou](https://anilist.co/staff/155926/)._
Originating from Oh! Production.
